name: Idaho Baked Potato Dip
author: McCormick Spice
summary: The state that's famous for its potatoes brings you the ultimate in game day-worthy appetizers: Baked Potato Dip. Mix mashed potatoes with milk and sour cream for a smooth base. Fold in Cheddar cheese, bacon and Grill Mates® Steak Marinade. It's smoky, sharp and exactly what your broccoli florets and potato chip dippers need.
ingredients: 1 pound russet or Idaho potatoes, peeled and quartered
1 (0.71 ounce) package McCormick® Grill Mates® Montreal Steak Marinade, divided
1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided
directions: Add 1 tablespoon of the Marinade Mix to water
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until potatoes are fork tender
Drain and return potatoes to saucepan
Add milk, sour cream, 1/2 cup of the cheese, 1/2 of the bacon and remaining Marinade Mix to saucepan
Mash potatoes using a potato masher or electric mixer until potatoes are smooth and creamy
Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and bacon
Bake 15 minutes or until heated through
